url.label: URL
url.description: The URL to send the request to

params.label: Query Parameters
params.description: The query parameters to send with the request

headers.label: Headers
headers.description: The headers to send with the request

aiCompletion.prompt:
You are an expert HTTP request headers generator. The user will provide a description of the request headers they want to send and you should create a valid JSON object that matches the description.
        You can expose dynamic variables using the {{syntax}}, for example {"X-Token": {{token}}} will expose the "token" as a dynamic input.
        User's prompt:
        {{prompt}}

        Existing value:
        {{value}}

        prefer lowerPascalCase for input names

DeleteAttribute.description: Deletes an attribute from an object

object.description: The object with the attribute deleted

GetAttribute.menuDescription: Used to retrieve a property from an object.
GetAttribute.description: Retrieves a property from an object

key.label: Key of the attribute to retrieve
key.description: Supports nested properties with dot notation

JSONParse.description: Parses a JSON string into an object

JSONStringify.description: Stringifies an object into a JSON string

ObjectEntries.description: Emits the entries of an object

ObjectKeys.description: Emits the keys of an object

ObjectValues.description: Emits the values of an object

SetAttribute.menuDescription: Sets an attribute on an object

key.description: Key of the attribute to set

value.description: Value to set the attribute to

object.description: The object with the attribute set

sum.description: The sum of the two numbers

difference.description: The difference of the two numbers

SumList.description: Emits the sum of a list of numbers

sum.description: The sum of the numbers in list

searchString.description: Search string for operations like includes, indexOf, startsWith, etc.

searchValue.description: String or regex to search for

strings.description: Strings to concatenate with the main string

Conditional.menuDescription: Evaluates the condition, and if it's true, emits the left operand value to the 'true' output, otherwise emits the left operand value to the 'false' output

true.description: Emits the left operand value if the condition is true

false.description: Emits the left operand value if the condition is false

LimitTimes.description: Item will be emitted until the limit is reached

times.description: The number of times to emit the item

Publish.description: Publishes a value by a key to all listeners in the current flow. Use 'Subscribe' to listen to events.

key.description: A key to use to subscribe to values

RoundRobin.menuDescription: Item will be emitted to one of the outputs in a round robin fashion

Subscribe.description: Subscribes to a value published by a key. Use 'Publish' to publish values.

key.description: A key to use to subscribe to values

value.description: The value published by the key

Switch.menuDescription: Allows you to switch between multiple outputs based on the value of one input or more, using code expressions

Log.description: Logs a value to the console

AccumulateSomeValuesByCount.description: Accumulates values sent to the "accept" input. Emits the list after the total items passed to both "accept" and "ignore" inputs reach the specified count.

count.description: Number of values to accumulate before emitting them

Append.description: Appends an item to a list

Flatten.description: Flattens a list of lists into a single list

GetListElement.description: Returns the element at the specified index

HeadAndRest.description: Receives a list and emits two outputs: the first item and the rest of the list

head.description: The first item in the list

listFrom.menuDescription: Receives a list of values and creates a list (array) from them

ListIsEmpty.description: Returns true if the list is empty

ListLength.description: Returns the length of a list

LoopList.description: Emits all values in a list

item.description: Will emit a value for each item in the list

index.description: Will emit the index of the item

length.description: Will emit the length of the list

Prepend.description: Prepends an item to a list

Remove.description: Removes an item from a list

RemoveAt.description: Removes an item from a list at the specified index

index.description: The index of the item to remove

Repeat.description: Repeats a value a number of times

times.description: How many times will the value be repeated

Slice.description: Returns a slice of a list from the specified start index to the specified end index

start.description: The index to start slicing from

end.description: The index to end slicing at

SpreadList.menuDescription: Receives an array and emits its values as separate outputs

Collect.menuDescription: Collects values into a list. Over time, count, or trigger.

GetGlobalState.description: Gets a value from the global state

defaultValue.description: Default value if key is not set

SetGlobalState.description: Sets a value in the global state

Delay.menuDescription: Delays a value by a given amount of time. Supports both static and dynamic delays.

Debounce.menuDescription: Emits the last value received after being idle for a given amount of milliseconds. Supports both static and dynamic delays.

Throttle.menuDescription: Limits the number of times a value is emitted to once per time configured. Supports both static and dynamic intervals.

InlineValue.menuDescription: Emits a value each time it's called. Supports dynamic variables

fields.label: Value
fields.description: The value to emit. Supports dynamic variables using {{syntax}}

aiCompletion.prompt:
You are an expert at generating values with variables. The user will provide a description of the value they want to use, and you should create a valid representation with appropriate dynamic variables.
You can expose dynamic variables using the {{syntax}}, for example "Hello, {{name}}" will expose the "name" as a dynamic input.
Only expose variables if needed, otherwise avoid them.

## Previous value:
{{value}}

## User request:
{{prompt}}

Prefer camelCase for variable names. Return only the generated value with no code formatting or backticks.
aiCompletion.placeholder: Describe the value you want to generate

CodeExpression.menuDescription: Evaluates a JS expression. Supports dynamic variables

Note.description: A note node for documentation purposes

apiKey.description: Supabase API key (service role or anon)

columns.description: Columns to select (comma-separated, or * for all)

limit.description: Maximum number of rows to return

single.description: Return a single row instead of an array

OpenAI.description: Generates a chat completion using OpenAI

prompt.defaultValue: Generate a summary of the following text: {{text}}

responseFormat.label: Response Format
responseFormat.description: Format of the response (text, JSON object, or structured JSON according to schema)

jsonSchema.label: JSON Schema
jsonSchema.description: JSON schema to structure the output (only used when responseFormat is 'json_schema')

aiCompletion.prompt: Generate a JSON schema matching the following requirements: {{prompt}}. Current schema: {{value}}
aiCompletion.placeholder: Describe the structure you want for your JSON output

OpenAIResponsesAPI.description: Interact with OpenAI's new Responses API for stateful, multimodal, and tool-augmented conversations.

input.description: Input prompt or array for multimodal (text, image, audio)

previousResponseId.description: ID of previous response to continue/fork conversation

conversationHistory.description: Array of conversation messages for controlled state

tools.description: Array of hosted tools to enable (e.g., [{ type: 'web_search' }])

toolChoice.description: How the model should use tools

response.description: The full response object from the API

responseId.description: The response ID for continuing conversations

maxRecords.description: Maximum number of records to retrieve

filterFormula.description: Filter formula in Airtable formula language

Anthropic.description: Generate text using Anthropic's Claude models
Anthropic.icon:

prompt.defaultValue: Generate a response to the following: {{text}}

maxTokens.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate

DiscordMessage.description: Sends a message to a Discord webhook

maxPages.description: Maximum number of pages to crawl

wait.description: Whether to wait for JavaScript to load

LLMCondition.description: Evaluates a condition using an LLM and emits the value to true/false outputs

model.description: The model to use for evaluation

value.description: The value to check against the condition

true.description: Emits the value when condition is true

false.description: Emits the value when condition is false

text.description: Plain text content of the email

waitForSelector.description: CSS selector to wait for before scraping

text.description: Plain text content of the email

attachments.description: Array of attachment objects with content, filename, type, and disposition

maxResults.description: Maximum number of results to return

includeDomains.description: Array of domains to include in search

excludeDomains.description: Array of domains to exclude from search

AppendFile.description: Appends a file to the file system

DeleteFile.description: Deletes a file from the file system

ReadFile.description: Reads a file from the file system

WriteFile.description: Writes a file to the file system

PostgreSQL.description: Executes a SQL query on a Postgres database and outputs the result

aiCompletion.prompt: Generate a SQL query matching the user's request. Existing query: {{prompt}} existijg SQL is: {{value}}
aiCompletion.placeholder: Describe your query in natural language

parameters.description: Optional JSON array of parameters for the SQL query

authMethod.label: Authentication Method
authMethod.description: Method to authenticate with Google Sheets API

accessToken.description: OAuth Access Token for Google API

serviceAccountKey.description: Service Account JSON key file contents

action.label: Action
action.description: Action to perform on the spreadsheet

spreadsheetId.description: ID of the Google Sheet document (found in the URL)

values.description: Data to write as a 2D array

valueInputOption.description: How input data should be interpreted
